net.hudup.core.logistic

Interface UriAssoc

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    UriAdapter, UriAssocAbstract

    public interface UriAssoc
extends AutoCloseable
    This interface proposes rules (methods) processing on objects identified by Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) as normal file when URI refers to any resource on net system. For example, creating, copying, renaming, deleting, getting reader, getting writer on objects (for example, files). Each object in UriAssoc is identified by URI or Path. It is possible to consider Path as particular case of URI. Note, URI is represented by xURI instead of URI. As a convention, a class that implements this interface are called URI associator. Note, URI associators are utility classes. There are two types of object in URI associator: store (like directory, folder in file system) and archive (like file in file system). Store contains archives and other stores. In general, URI associators are very necessary to input-output operators.
    Version:
    11.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

      • getOutputStream

        java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream(xURI uri,
                                     boolean append)
        Retrieving the output stream of the object identified by specified URI. Such output stream is used for writing later.
        Parameters:
        uri - Specified URI
        append - Whether or not "append" mode is applied for writing. In "append" mode, content is added continuously to the end of the archive (file). Otherwise, the archive (file) is made empty and then content is put into the archive (file) from beginning.
        Returns:
        Output stream of the resource object identified by specified URI

        Returns:
        Reader of the resource object identified by specified URI

      • getWriter

        java.io.Writer getWriter(xURI uri,
                         boolean append)
        Retrieving the Writer of the resource object identified by specified URI. Such Writer is used for writing later.
        Parameters:
        uri - specified URI of the resource object.
        append - Whether or not "append" mode is applied for writing. In "append" mode, content is added continuously to the end of the archive (file). Otherwise, the archive (file) is made empty and then content is put into the archive (file) from beginning.
        Returns:
        Writer of the resource object identified by specified URI

      • chooseUri

        xURI chooseUri(java.awt.Component comp,
               boolean open,
               java.lang.String[] exts,
               java.lang.String[] descs,
               xURI curStore,
               java.lang.String defaultExt)
        This method shows a graphic user interface (GUI) allowing users to select object (archive-file, store-directory) they want. Such GUI is called choice dialog. Such chosen object is returned by its referred URI.
        Parameters:
        comp - The graphic user interface (GUI) component works as a parent component of choice dialog.
        open - If true then, choice dialog is open dialog allowing users to choose and open files. Otherwise, choice dialog is save dialog allowing users to choose and save objects.
        exts - The specified array of archive (file) extensions which are used to filter objects that users select, for example, "*.hdp", "*.xls". Each extension has a description. The respective array of extension descriptions is specified by the parameter descs. This parameter can be null.
        descs - The specified array of descriptions, for example, "Hudup file", "Excel 97-2003". Note that each extension has a description and the respective array of file extensions is represented by the parameter exts. This parameter can be null.
        curStore - Current store (directory) to open choice dialog. Current store can be null.
        defaultExt - default extension can be null.
        Returns:
        URI represented by xURI of chosen object.

      • chooseDefaultUri

        xURI chooseDefaultUri(java.awt.Component comp,
                      boolean open,
                      xURI curStore)
        This method is similar to the method chooseUri(Component, boolean, String[], String[], xURI, String) when it also allows users to select object except that it only lists default objects for choice. In current implementation, defaults objects are archives (files) having extensions: "*.*" (all files), "*.hdp" (Hudup files), and "*.xls" (97-2003 Excel files).
        Parameters:
        comp - The graphic user interface (GUI) component works as a parent component of choice dialog.
        open - If true then, choice dialog is open dialog allowing users to choose and open files. Otherwise, choice dialog is save dialog allowing users to choose and save objects.
        curStore - Current store (directory) to open choice dialog. Current store can be null.
        Returns:
        URI represented by xURI of chosen object.

      • chooseStore

        xURI chooseStore(java.awt.Component comp)
        This method shows choice dialog allowing users to select only store (directory).
        Parameters:
        comp - The graphic user interface (GUI) component works as a parent component of choice dialog.
        Returns:
        URI represented by xURI of chosen store (directory).
